result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean E Mathews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
  If revoked, court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be paid during the period of extended supervision.
- Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
- Restitution is set at zero.

- No contact with firearms.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
- NO CONTACT with Danielle M., Deshawn M. or Shawn M., UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent.

- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and continued programming.
- Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- Parenting classes.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- AODA and recommended treatment; maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: - Serve 180 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 8/26/16 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (34 pages) SENTENCING HEARING, commencing MAY 13, 2016, received and filed.
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.
Bail refund packet
Rescheduling order, filed

Defendant Sean E Mathews in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.    State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Negotiations placed on the record by the state.  Sentencing proceeded.  State's correction to PSI placed on the record.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Danielle M. and Michael Barber.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 3 1/2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to any other sentence.  CONFINEMENT of 1 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation with the State Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.  Court found defendant NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Programs.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Serve 180 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 8/26/16 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.
- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and continued programming.
- Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- AODA and recommended treatment; maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Parenting classes.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO CONTACT with Danielle M., Deshawn M. or Shawn M., UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.  If revoked, court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be paid during the period of extended supervision.
- Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
- Restitution is set at zero.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of appeal rights.

RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services pretrial report received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Sean E Mathews in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing began. Due to reasons placed on the record, court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
PSI received and filed.
JUSTICE POINT PRETRIAL REPORT, FILED

Defendant Sean E Mathews in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, Court amended charge to Child Abuse - Recklessly Cause Harm, contrary to Wisc. Stats. 948.033)(b), a Class I Felony. Court ordered Repeater Enhancer DIMISSED. 

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 Dismissed, But Read In. 

Defense requests a PSI be ordered without recommendation. Court ordered PSI without recommendation.  

Case adjourned to branch 24 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sean E Mathews in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. State placed offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. State revoked offer. Case scheduled for Jury Trial on 2/8/2016 at 8:30 am. Case adjourned to branch 24.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sean E Mathews in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Sean E Mathews in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  The Court enters not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  The Court advises defense and the defendant of prior contact with this defendant while employed as an assistant district attorney as set forth on the record.  Defense confers with defendant.  Defendant wishes to proceed on today with this commissioner.  Hearing continued.  Defense indicates that the address in the criminal complaint is incorrect.  The Court accepts amendment based upon scribner's error; address corrected.
